column4: UPDATE 1-Metro bids for private equity firm EQT's Classic Fine Foods - sources
column5: HONGKONG/FRANKFURT  May 7 German retail group Metro has made a tentative bid for private equity-owned Classic Fine Foods in a deal potentially worth $300-$400 million including debt  three sources familiar with the deal said.

column4: Metro bids for EQT's Classic Fine Foods -sources
column5: FRANKFURT  May 7 German retail group Metro  has made a tentative bid for private equity-owned  Singapore-based Classic Fine Foods in a deal potentially worth $300-$400 million including debt  three sources familiar with the deal said.

column4: Guyana says Exxon discovers oil in offshore block
column5: GEORGETOWN  May 7 Exxon Mobil Corp has discovered oil off the coast of Guyana  the company and the South American nation's government said on Thursday  potentially inflaming a long-running territorial dispute with neighboring Venezuela.

column4: Exxon says breakdown in unit caused flaring at Torrance refinery
column5: May 6 Exxon Mobil Corp said a breakdown related to an unspecified unit caused flaring at its 149 500-barrel-per-day refinery in Torrance  California  on Wednesday.

column4: Goldman Sachs must face $120 mln suit over mortgage securities -court
column5: New York's top state court on Thursday revived a bond insurer's $120 million lawsuit claiming Goldman Sachs Group Inc lied about a pool of securities backed by subprime mortgages during the period leading up the financial crisis.

column4: Exclusive: Hess-owned oil railcars involved in North Dakota derailment
column5: WILLISTON  N.D. A BNSF train that derailed in central North Dakota on Wednesday was carrying railcars owned by Hess Corp  10 of which caught fire and forced the evacuation of a nearby town  the oil producer told Reuters late Wednesday.

column4: Fitch Rates Host Hotels & Resorts' Series E Notes 'BBB-'; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK  May 07 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned a 'BBB-' rating to Host  Hotels & Resorts Limited Partnership's (Host) $500 million series E senior  unsecured notes due June 15  2025. Host plans to use the net proceeds and cash  on hand to redeem its 5.875% $500 million series X notes due 2019. The company  anticipates paying an aggregate redemption price of approximately $515 million.  A full list of Fitch's ratings for Host follow

column4: BTG Pactual may be interested in HSBC's Brazil unit -report
column5: SAO PAULO  May 7 Grupo BTG Pactual SA  the largest independent investment bank in emerging markets  could be interested in acquiring the Brazilian unit of HSBC Holdings Plc  which has been put up for sale  Valor Econômico newspaper reported on Thursday.

column4: MOVES-Bothamley takes global helm for HSBC syndicate
column5: LONDON  May 7 (IFR) - Adam Bothamley has been appointed as global head of debt syndicate at HSBC  according to an internal memo seen by IFR.

column4: Fitch: HSBC's Strong 1Q Profit Driven by Asia  Europe and Trading
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) HONG KONG/LONDON  May 07 (Fitch) HSBC Holdings plc's  (AA-/F1+/Stable) reported  pre-tax profit of USD7.1bn in 1Q15 was strong  in Fitch Ratings' view  due to  improved performance in its Global Banking and Markets (GB&M) business line   steady contributions from commercial and retail banking  controlled expenses and  moderate loan impairments. The pre-tax profit rose by 4% from 1Q14's.  Non-recurring items  overall  were not material.

column4: Lockheed F-35 gets first female pilot: Air Force
column5: WASHINGTON Lieutenant Colonel Christine Mau  a U.S. Air Force pilot who    was part of the first all-female combat sortie over Afghanistan in 2011  this week became the first woman to fly the Lockheed Martin Corp F-35 jet  the Air Force said on Wednesday.

column5: May 7 Hardwood retailer Lumber Liquidators Holdings Inc is halting sales of all its Chinese laminate flooring with immediate effect  CNBC reported  citing a source familiar with the matter.

column4: Striking Lyondell Houston refinery workers OK new contract: union
column5: HOUSTON Hourly workers striking against LyondellBasell Industries NV's  Houston refinery voted on Thursday to ratify a new four-year contract  clearing a key hurdle on the way to ending a three-month-long strike  according to a union official.

column4: UPDATE 3-Manulife first-quarter profit falls; dividend raised

column4: Manulife posts lower first-quarter profit  increases dividend
column5: TORONTO  May 7 Manulife Financial Corp  Canada's largest insurer  reported a lower first-quarter profit on Thursday  hurt by weakness in U.S. wealth management sales and the impact of energy holdings on its investment business.

column4: Morgan Stanley renews U.S. oil storage deal ahead of trading unit sale
column5: NEW YORK Morgan Stanley's commodities group has renewed a refined product storage deal with TransMontaigne Partners L.P. seven months early  as the Wall Street bank plans to sell its physical oil business.

column4: BRIEF-Unilever opens offer to increase stake in Unilever Nigeria
column5: * Opening of offer to increase its equity stake in Unilever Nigeria Plc from 50.10 pct up to a maximum of 75 pct

column4: ArcelorMittal cuts 2015 view on U.S. steel  weak mining
column5: BRUSSELS ArcelorMittal  the world's largest producer of steel  on Thursday cut its profit forecast for 2015 due to a more bearish view of the U.S. steel market and the impact of falling iron ore prices on its mining business.

column4: UPDATE 2-ArcelorMittal cuts 2015 view on U.S. steel  weak mining
column5: * Cuts global steel market growth view to 0.5-1.5 pct   (Adds CFO comments  analyst reaction  share price)

column4: ArcelorMittal cuts 2015 outlook on more bearish market view
column5: BRUSSELS  May 7 ArcelorMittal  the world's largest producer of steel  on Thursday cut its profit guidance for 2015 due to a more bearish view of the U.S. steel market and the impact of falling iron ore prices on its mining business.

column4: Disney names Leslie Ferraro president of consumer products unit
column5: May 7 Walt Disney Co on Thursday named its parks and resorts' executive vice president of marketing  Leslie Ferraro  as president of its fast-growing consumer products division.

column4: Consumer review website operator Yelp exploring sale: WSJ
column5: Yelp Inc  the operator of consumer review website Yelp.com  is exploring a sale that could fetch more than $3.5 billion  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: UPDATE 3-Consumer review website operator Yelp exploring sale - WSJ
column5: May 7 Yelp Inc  the operator of consumer review website Yelp.com  is exploring a sale that could fetch more than $3.5 billion  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing people familiar with the matter.

column5: * Dow gains 0.45 pct  S&P 500 up 0.38 pct  Nasdaq up 0.53 pct   (Updates to close)

column5: May 7 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2000 GMT on Thursday:

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Argentina raises more cash in local bond sale
column5: BUENOS AIRES  May 7 Argentina raised 5.263 billion pesos ($589.7 million) from a sale of local debt on Thursday  the economy ministry said  continuing a drive to drum up cash at home  given its fiscal deficit  upcoming debt payments and difficulty accessing global credit markets.

column4: UPDATE 2-Argentina's YPF reports higher than expected net Q1 profit
column5: BUENOS AIRES  May 7 Argentina's state energy company YPF posted better than expected first-quarter profit on Thursday but earnings were still down 24.3 percent on the year due to the global slide in oil prices.

column4: Argentina says opens auction for $1.12 bln in new sovereign bonds
column5: BUENOS AIRES  May 7 Argentine will reopen an outstanding bond issue and sell new sovereign debt for a combined $1.12 billion  the country's official gazette said on Thursday  after state oil company YPF placed $1.5 billion in debt last month.

column4: Gran Tierra posts weaker than expected quarterly results
column5: TORONTO  May 7 Gran Tierra Energy  the most recent target of activist investor West Face Capital  reported a much wider than expected first-quarter net loss  as the pullback in oil prices weighed on the oil and gas company's results.
